Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: If Ahok become President, the thing is: he will need a very good backing that can do his work. A man like Ahok if taking such high office would at least one or two of his subordinates in the higher ups to do significant tasks

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: A ruler without his faithful ministers is nothing more but a poor ruler

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: No ruler ruled alone

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: Ahok will need able people to support him in the office

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: And they are going to be very rare for his case

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: Let's say it is PDIP members. Who's to say these PDIP members won't be loyal to him and instead to PDIP party itself

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: With the schism of PDIP however in these days, it could be possible but hardly give enough competent members or candidates to support his cabinet to be fairly effective as we wanted

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: He could went professional routes then choosing independent candidates, but won't his parties want pieces of the positions too to protect their own power and influence.

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: And depending on the condition, if there is a coalition between PDIP with other parties, he will need to give some positions to these parties too

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: And would they do their job right for the sake of Ahok or for the sake of parties and their own motives?

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: Most likely the latter

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: He is a man fit to work in the shadows, but as a man to work in front of greater public, many can attack fairly easily

Author: .ayab
Content:
There's also a possibility that DPR would actually do their jobs that is within their rights and exercise them and not becoming the president stamp for seal of approval.

But instead for the people but for their own interest and blocking any reform he proposed

Author: .ayab
Content: Do you think that ahok have a better chance being elected if we live in a parliamentary democracy or a constitutional monarchy?

Author: .ayab
Content: It would make most of the islamist extremist argument somewhat void

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: A parliamentary democracy would be a better option considering he would mainly play in the legislative continously. And ngl, if this government is a parliamentary democracy to begin with, Ahok would most likely survive as a member than the irl counterpart

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: Constitutional Monarchy tho, would be the worst one

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: Considering Javanism will persist under the King's rule, and we might even see dynastic struggles between the three to four houses of Mataram successors. Ahok would simply become a part of it, and have lesser chance to get an elevation considering Javanism and its traditions became highly defended

Content: Almost reminded me of Thailand

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: Oh boi, now this is getting interesting. There might be even a competition for Borneo part. Panglimas trying to get their daughters married into Java King, but intervened by Banjarnese Dynasty, or in some cases if other want to form an alliance on other country: Malaysian or Brunei's Dynasty Houses

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: But let's assume Banjar Dynasty since they are the most famous for Kalimantan

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: We would instead see families from Banjar, Aceh and Java entering the parliament as part of representation to keep the three islands together through 3 influential noble houses

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: And the King might do it directly nor indirectly

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: Depending on how the parliament itself reacted to it

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: But from the looks of it, even the parliament can be conservative and allowed the King to do so in a moderate amount at best (though not to the point it will decrease their power greatly)

Author: .ayab
Content: Us not having a natural route of progressing our society because of dutch colonial rule really fucked us huh

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: What I am interested with is that since the parliament is ruling under the King by constitution with degrees of autonomy, you might even see smaller factions inside these houses too. Businessmen, nobles, artisans, military or police officials, etc. Ahok can eventually entered one of the sub factions to elevate himself then became a popular figure to be a part of the face of the faction as a broad image

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: For example, even Acehnese nobility can be splitted due to their backgrounds and opinions too. Moderates, radicals, conservative, etc

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: And these nobles could use Ahok as a minister of their own by putting him inside the parliament

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: Which he might shine through as an able minister or parliament member

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: Though the stronger faction I suggest him to be in would obviously be Javanese faction, the more polarized faction compared to Borneo or Aceh with their own sub factions

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: The question is, would he support Mangkunagaran, Yogyakarta, Pakulaman or Surakarta Dynastic lines should a succession happen (or at least associated himself with it)

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content: Ahok would need to be strategic in choosing the right heir for his own agenda too
